page.title: 10Door-to-door Surveys
page.content: CROSS COTTAGE This building was built in the 14th century by prisoners of the wars in France.There is a garage on one end,which when first built was a wash-house. STAPLES PLACE This old cottage is positioned neatly beside the church gate.It has a small barn beside it,which used to be a blacksmiths.It is built from flint,but has never been thatched.It was built in the 18th century,and is still in its original condition. THE POST OFFICE This,at 500 years,is one of the village's oldest buildings,and has been a shop since its construction. However,100 years ago,it was moved to its present position,next to the River Lavant.It is built from chalk,stone and plaster,which is an old method.
